www.lawcommission.gov.np  
1 
 Muslim Commission Act, 2074 (2017)  
Date of Authentication and Publication:                                            
October 15 , 2017 ( 2074.06.29 )  
Amending Acts:  
The Act Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019 (2075)    March 3, 2019 ( 2075.11.19 ) 
 
Act No. 31 of the  year 2017 (2074)  
An Act Made to make arrangements relating to Muslim  Commission  
 
Preamble:  Whereas, it is expedient to make necessary arrangements relating 
to Muslim Commission for the ide ntification of the history and culture of the 
Muslim Community, protection and promotion of the rights and interests of 
the Muslim  Community and the empowerment of the  Muslim  community ,  
Now, therefore, be it enacted by the Federal Parliament pursuant to 
Article 296 sub -article (1) of the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -1 
Preliminary  
 
1. Short title and Commencement : (1) This Act may be called "  Muslim  
Commission Act, 2017 (2074)."  
  (2)  This act shall come into force immediately.  
2. Definitions : Unless the subject or the context o therwise requires, in 
this Act, -

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
2 
 (a)  "Chairperson" means the Chairperson of the 
 Commission and the word also includes the member 
 working as the Acting Chairperson.  
(b)  "Commission" means the National Muslim 
 Commissi on established under Article 264  of the 
 Constitution.  
(c)  "Prescribed" or "As prescribed" means laws 
 prescribed or as prescribed under the Rules framed 
 under this Act.  
(d)  "Muslim " means the community  as defined by the 
 Government of Nepal on the basis of the 
 recommendation made by the Muslim  Commission.  
(e)  "Memb er" means the member of the Commission and 
 the word also includes the Chairperson.  
(f)  "Constitution" means the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -2 
Qualifications of the Chairperson and Members and Vacancy of Post  
 
3. Qualifications of the Chairperson and Members : The following 
 persons shall be qualified to be the Chairperson and Member of the 
 Commission: - 
(a)  person from the Muslim  community, having 
 contributed for at least ten years for the protection, 
 promotion of the rights and interests of the Muslim  
 community, having contributed in the social sector

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
3 
  and the empowerment or development of the 
 community or having made significant contribution in 
 the field of human rights,  
(b)  holding a bachelor's degree in the relevant subject from a 
 recognized university,  
(c)  not being a member of any political party at the time 
 of appointment,  
(d)  having attained the age of forty -five years,  
(e)  being of high moral character.  
4. Vacancy of post : The post of the Chairperson or Member of the 
Commission shall be vacant in  any of the following circumstances: - 
(a)  if he or she tenders resignation in writing to the President,  
(b) if he or she attains the age of sixty -five years,  
(c) if the tenure of the post ends pursuant to sub -article (3) 
of Article 263 of the Constitution,  
(d) if a moti on of impeachment is passed against him or her 
under Article 101 of the Constitution,  
(e) if he or she is removed from post by the President on 
recommendation of the Constitutional Council on 
grounds of his or her inability to hold office and 
discharge the fun ctions due to physical or mental illness,  
(f) if he or she dies.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
4 
 5. Reappointment shall not be done : The Chairperson and Members 
appointed shall not reappointed.  
   Provided that a member may be appointed to the post of 
Chairperson, and when a member is so appointed as the Chairperson, his 
or her term of post shall be computed so as to include his or her term as 
the member.  
6. Not to be appointed in other government service s: A person appointed 
as the Chairperson or a  member of the Commission shall not be eligible 
for appointment in other government service s. 
  However , nothing in this clause shall be deemed to be a bar to the 
appointment to any political position or to any position which requires 
making investigations , inquiries or findings on any subject, or submitting 
advice, opinion or recommendation after carrying out a study or research 
on any subject.  
 
Chapter -3 
Power, Functions and Duties of the Commission  
 
7. Power, Functions and Duties of the Commission : The power, 
 function and duties of the Commission shall be as follows: -  
(a)  to conduct study on the overall situation of the 
Muslim  community and to make recommendations in 
that relation, to the Government of Nepal for policy, 
legal and institutional reform s,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
5 
 (b) to formulate national policy and programs for the 
promotion and protection of the rights and interests 
of the  Muslim  community and the empowerment of 
such community and to make recommendation to the 
Government of Nepal for their  implementation,  
(c) to conduct study  and research on whether the 
provisions and arrangements  made for the promotion 
and protection of the rights and interests of the 
Muslim  community and the ir empowerment have 
been effectively implemented , and to make 
suggestions to the Governme nt of Nepal for the 
measures to be taken for their  effective 
implementation,  
(d) to make suggestions to the Government of Nepal 
regarding the reforms in terms of legal, policy and 
institutional measures, required for the promotion 
and protection of the rights and interests of the 
Muslim community and the empowerment of such 
community,  
(e) to review, monitor and evaluate the implementation 
of the policy and programs related to the  Muslim  
community,  
(f) to monitor or cause to monitor  the implementation 
of the recommenda tions made or suggestions given 
by the Commission,  
(g) to formulate special programs for the development 
and empowerment of economically or socially

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
6 
 indigent people within the Muslim  community  and to  
make recommendations to the Government of Nepal 
for their  implementation,  
(h) to conduct study  and research into the language, 
script, culture, history, tradition, literature, art 
within the  Muslim  community, and to  formulate 
program for the protection and development of such 
language, script, culture, history, trad ition, 
literature, art  and to  make recommendations to the 
Government of Nepal  for its implementation , 
(i) to conduct awareness generating program s for the 
protection and promotion of the rights and interests 
of the Muslim community  and the empowerment of 
such  community,  
(j) to formulate  programs to end all forms of 
exploitation and for the empowerment of  the Muslim  
community and to make recommendations to the 
Government of Nepal,  
(k) to monitor the implementation of the international 
treaties, agreements relating to  the Muslim  
community  that Nepal is  a party to , and to make 
recommendations or suggestions to the Government 
of Nepal for their  implementation , 
(l) to collect complaints against the persons or 
organizations that violate the rights of the Muslim  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
7 
 community and to make recommendation to 
concerned agency to conduct investigation and 
prosecution over such complaints,  
(m)  to identify the Muslim community  by means of 
detailed study  and research , and to make 
recommendations to the Government of Nepal to 
make lists of Surnames,  
(n) to formulate policy and programs to establish and 
mobilize living museum for the protection and 
promotion of the physical, non -physical culture  of 
the Muslim  community  and to make 
recommendations to the Government of Nepal for 
their implementation,  
(o) to review, monitor and evaluate awareness 
generating programs conducted by the Government 
of Nepal and other organizations and institutions for 
the protection, promotion and empow erment of the 
Muslim community,  
(p) to conduct study and research on the backwardness 
of the Muslim community and existing bad 
conditions  in terms of educational, political, social 
and economic situation and to make suggestions to 
the Government of Nepal for the development of the 
community,  
(q) to formulate and implement the code of conduct for 
the Chairperson, Members and employees of the 
Commission,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
8 
 (r) to approve the annual plans and program of the 
Commission.  
8. May obtain opinion and consultations : The Commission, in relation 
 to its functions and duties,  may receive opinions and seek consultations 
 from any constitutional organ, government office or public entity.  
9. May obtain service of experts : The Commission may receive 
 services from experts, pursuant to the federal law by stating the 
 reasons thereof, if the human resource employed within the 
 Commission is unable to  perform any work t hat the Commission is 
 required to perform as per the Constitution, this Act and prevailing 
 federal law.  
10.  May form  committee or working group : (1) The Commission may 
 form a committee or working group to perform specific tasks related 
 to the Commission, by formulating a procedure.  
(2) The terms or scope of operation of the committee or working 
group formed pursuant to sub -section (1), shall be as prescribed by the 
Commission at the time of its formation.  
(3) While forming the committee or work ing group pursuant to 
sub-section (1), there shall be representation based on the principle of 
proportional representation, as enshrined in the Constitution.  
11.  Coordination and Cooperation : The Commission may, on the basis 
of necessity, coordinate and cooperate with government agencies or 
public entities.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
9 
 Chapter - 4 
Operation of the Commission  
 
12. Office of the Commission : (1) An  office of the Comm ission shall be 
established in the Kathmandu Valley for the operation of work of the 
Commission.  
(2) The Commission may, on the basis of necessity, establish 
offices in the provincial level.  
13. Meeting of the Commission : (1) The meeting of the Commission shall 
decide the activities to be performed by the Commission in accordance  
with this Act.  
 (2)  The meeting of the Commission shall be held on such a date, 
time and venue as prescribed by the Chairperson, based on necessity.  
  (3)  The Secretary of the Commission shall  finalize and notify all 
members of the date, time and venue of the meeting along  with a list of 
the agenda to be discussed in the meeting, at least 48 hours prior to the 
meeting.  
 (4)  Any member interested to discuss additional matters, not 
included within the list of  agenda set to be discussed in the meeting 
pursuant to sub -section (3), shall notify the Secretary of the additional 
matter s and reason for their  introduction to the meeting 24 hours prior to 
the meeting. Upon receipt of such information, the Secretary of the 
Commission shall notify all members and such matter shall be co nsidered 
to have been included in the list.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
10 
  (5) Notwithstanding anything stated in sub -sections (3) and (4), a 
matter not included within the list may be introduced and decided by the 
Commission, with the agreement of all members present in the meeting.  
 (6) The quorum of the meeting shall be deemed to have been 
fulfilled with the presence of more than 50 percent of the immediate 
members of the Commission.  
 (7) The meeting of the Commission shall be chaired by the 
Chairperson of the Commission.  
 (8) The  decision of the majority shall be the decision of the 
Commission and in case of a tie, the Chairperson shall give a decisive 
vote.  
 (9) The Secretary of the Commission shall create a depository of  
the decision of the Commission, authenticating  it with th e signatures of 
the Chairperson and Members.  
 (10) The Secretary of the Commission shall be a gazetted first class 
officer of the Nepal Civil Service. The senior most official of the 
Commission shall act as the Secretary of the Commission until the 
appoi ntment of such official.  
  (11) Other procedures related to the meeting  of the Commission 
 shall be as determined by the Commission  
14.  Not to take part in the decision making in case of conflict of interest :  
If any member of the Commission has any inter est, concern or benefit  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
11 
 arising from any issue under consideration in the Commission or if the 
near relatives of such persons stand to benefit directly or indirectly, such 
member should give prior information to the Commission regarding such 
matters and su ch member shall not take part in the decision making 
process of the Commission concerning such matters.  
15.  Work Division : The division of the work of the Chairperson and Member 
shall be as fixed by the Commission.  
16.  Work to be performed as an acting : The senior most Member of the 
Commission, shall work as the acting Chairperson,  if the position of the 
Chairperson falls vacant due to any reason, is unable to perform work 
pursuant to sub -article (6) of Article 101 of the Constitution, has gone for 
a foreign visit or is on leave for more than 7 days.   
17.  Work, performance of the Commission not to be interrupted : The 
vacancy of post of any Member shall not interrupt the works of the 
Commission  
  ...............  
Chapter -5 
Miscellaneous  
 
18.  Organizational Structure and Employees of the Commission : (1) The 
organizational structure and appointment of employees of the  
Commission shall be as approv ed by the Government of Nepal.  
                                                           
 
  Removed by The A ct Amending  Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
12 
  (2) The Government of Nepal shall make available the employees 
neces sary for the Commission to perform its work.  
19.  Duties and Conduct of Post:  (1) The duties and conduct of the post to be 
adhered by the Chairperson and Members of the Commission shall be as 
follows:  
(a)  to perform the obligations of the post independently, 
 impartially and honestly for the empowerment of the 
 Muslim Community  and t o protect and promote the 
 rights, interests of the Muslim community ,  
(b)  not to commit any act that would create discord in  
 the relationship between different ethnicities, 
 communities and identities.  
 (2) The Chairperson and the Members of the Commission shall 
adhere to the code of conduct as prescribed by this Act or prevailing 
federal laws.  
20.  Cooperation to be extended : It shall be the duty of any agency or official 
with which the Commission seeks assistance, to cooperate with the 
Commission in course of the performance of its functions.   
21. Power to send for implementation in writing : If the Commission finds 
that any agency or official has not made available necessary assistance to 
the Commission, it may write to the higher agency or official above such 
agency or official for assistance in the matter.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
13 
 22.  Annual report : (1) The Commiss ion shall submit an annual report of the 
work and activities of the Commission, to the president within three 
months of the date of expiry of the fiscal year.  
 (2) The report made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall inter -alia, 
include the following matters , in addition to other details:  -  
(a) Details of implementation of annual programs of 
 the Commission and expenses incurred,  
(b) Details of suggestions, recommendations given by 
the Commission to Nepal  Government or any 
other agency,  
(c) The status of the implementation of the 
suggestions, recommendations gi ven in 
accordance to clause (b),   
(d) Situation of physical and economic resources of 
the Commission and their utilization , 
(e) Details of other activities performed by the 
Commission in course of fulfilling the  
responsibilities required to be fulfill ed by it, in 
accordance to this Act.  
23.  Liaison with Government of Nepal : The Ministry of Federal Affairs 
 and General Administration  shall liaise the Commission with the 
 Government of Nepal.  
24.  Delegation of Power : The Commission may delegate s ome authority 
 accorded to it by this Act, as per necessity, with set conditions for its use 
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
14 
  and adherence, to the Chairperson, Member, Government of Nepal, State 
 Government, official employee of any agency or Local Government.  
25. .....................  
26. Protection of the action taken in Good Faith : No legal proceedings 
 shall be initiated against the Members of the Commission, employees or 
 any person deputed by the Commission for any action performed under 
 this Act or Rules framed under this Act,  in good faith.  
27. Power to frame rules : (1) The Commission may frame necessary rules 
 for the implementation of this Act.  
  (2) The Commission shall have to get the approval of the  
 Government of Nepal, Ministry of Finance , while making rules pursuant 
 to subsection (1), on matters that impose financial burden or liability on 
 the Government of Nepal.  
  (3) The rules made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall come into 
 force, from the date of publi cation in the Nepal Gazette.  
28.  Power to frame Directives : The Commission may, subject to this Act or 
 Rules framed under this Act, issue directives to conduct or cause to 
 conduct the smooth operation of its work.  
29. Repeal and Savings : (1) National Muslim Commission , formed in 
accordance to the notice published in the Nepal Gazzette on Jestha 8, 2069 
B.S., is hereby repealed.  
                                                           
  Repealed by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) . 
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
15 
  (2) The acts and actions performed by the Commission pursuant 
to sub -section (1), shall be deemed to have been performed unde r this 
Act. 
 (3) The members appointed under the National Muslim 
Commission, pursuant to sub -section (1), shall be discharged from their 
post automatically, with the operation of this Act.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
16 
  Schedule  
..............................
